definition.name: Create Blog from Markdown Files
definition.description: This action allows you to create a blog from your markdown files and deploy to GitHub pages
definition.author: Kamran Ahmed <kamranahmed.se@gmail.com>

inputs.name: token
inputs.description:
This option defaults to the repository scoped GitHub Token.
However if you need more permissions for things such as deploying to another repository, you can add a Personal Access Token (PAT) here. This should be stored in the `secrets / with` menu **as a secret**.

inputs.name: branch
inputs.description: This is the branch you wish to deploy to, for example gh-pages or docs.

outputs.name: deployment-status
outputs.description: The status of the deployment that indicates if the run failed or passed. Possible outputs include: success|failed|skipped

evidence.reasoning: The action is primarily focused on deploying a blog created from markdown files to GitHub Pages, which falls under the Deployment category. Additionally, it involves creating documentation (the blog) and publishing it online.
